messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] OT diana help
messages.msgSnippet: ... There are photos of Hannah and her family (and some others: Gail s family, some of mine on the linked pics) here: http://sandradodd.com/jenner I d prefer
messages.messageBody:
On Feb 25, 2006, at 11:54 PM, Kim H wrote:

> I'm so very, very sorry for the loss of a beautiful little girl. I
> have no words - they would just be so inadequate but I wanted to
> let Diane know that I'm so sorry for her and her families loss.
> What a tragedy.

There are photos of Hannah and her family (and some others: Gail's
family, some of mine on the linked pics) here:
http://sandradodd.com/jenner

I'd prefer to keep the discussion off this list. If anyone wants to
know more or wants to help, please write to me on the side
Sandra@...
and if that address doesn't show it ends with SandraDodd.com and
starts with Sandra

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] OT diana help
messages.msgSnippet: I m so very, very sorry for the loss of a beautiful little girl. I have no words - they would just be so inadequate but I  wanted to let Diane know that I m so
messages.messageBody:
I'm so very, very sorry for the loss of a beautiful little girl. I have no words - they would just be so inadequate but I wanted to let Diane know that I'm so sorry for her and her families loss. What a tragedy.

My prayers are with them.

Kim
----- Original Message -----
From: Ren Allen
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, February 26, 2006 2:56 PM
Subject: [AlwaysLearning] OT diana help


I realized that I posted the former message without explanation. I
assumed all the lists were talking about it, then realized there was
nothing yet.
Hannah Jenner died a couple of nights ago. For anyone wanting to help,
the former email was Rue's post to the email list set up to assist them.

Ren
